channel.title: earnings on FinanClub
channel.description: Recent content in earnings on FinanClub

item.title: BEKE
item.description: score:-42 Chances: KE Holdings to report Q2 2023 financial results. BEKE listed in Forbes’ Global 2000 for the first time. Analysts believe BEKE could rally 42.95%, potential upside. BEKE’s P/S ratio is on the mark. Promising growth potential in the Chinese real estate market.

item.title: LYG
item.description: score:-58 Chances: Positive Q2 2023 earnings call transcript. Lloyds Banking Group beats profit forecasts. Lloyds Banking Group raises dividends. Investor returns of 47% over the last three years. Expansion of banking sector and market recovery. Risks: Challenges from bad loan risks and economic fluctuations.

item.title: ASX
item.description: score:175 Chances: ASE Technology Holding achieves the best overall performance on the Dow Jones Sustainability Indices. ASE’s Bumping Factory in Kaohsiung, Taiwan inducted into the World Economic Forum’s Global Lighthouse Network. ASE announces advancements under the VIPack™ Platform. ASX reports positive Q2 2023 earnings results.

item.title: BBD
item.description: score:-96 Chances: CEOs of major Brazil lenders see ‘unique opportunity’ for local economy. Amazon set to launch credit card in Brazil with Bradesco. Bankers expect lower delinquency rates with easing cycle in Brazil. BBD reports positive Q2 2023 earnings results. Risks: BBD’s profit plunges 76%, bad loan provisions near $3 billion.

item.title: HAYW
item.description: score:996 Chances: Hayward Holdings reported strong earnings and revenue surprises for Q2 2023, indicating positive performance and potential growth prospects. The company’s focus on pool and outdoor living technology aligns with evolving consumer preferences for outdoor leisure, potentially driving demand for its products.
